Reviews.Title: “Good location , Service lukewarm”
Reviews.Author: BBMON
Reviews.Content: Check-in process at the reception was fast. The room I have booked is a Studio apartment. It is understandably small as it is on a prime location. Accessibility is convenient and not difficult to locate. However, it may be challenging to get a taxi as it is a deadend road and not many cabs are seen turning into the lane, nevertheless public transport e.g. buses and mtr station is in the vincinity of the hotel. Fridays and Saturdays evening can be a little rowdy as the more crowds were seen at the pubs/ restaurants. No issue with the speed of the lift (not extremely slow but just got to be a little patient). The shower is strong and powerful though the shower area is small. Generally the room is clean but the location of the air-con in the room is badly situated and it can be rather stuffy when you are lying on the bed as the air-con does not blow towards the direction of the bed. During my stay, two ceiling lights was burnt out so it was a little dim at night but sufficient lument to get by things. The corridors are not air-conditioned and it is very warm (not stuffy) when you have been waiting a little longer for the lift just outside your room. I also note that there is a big metal cabinet on wheels meant for collection of soiled towel near one of the emergency exit at the 10 floor. This is a potential fire hazard, for the safety of your guset please do not leave the cabinet although there are two doors that lead to the same staircase. One feedback I would like the hotel to note is that, the quality of pillows is very important to your guest, do not provide flat pillows that are of no support to the neck. I had a stiff neck after the first night and subsequently felt better after requesting for extra pillows. The service of the bistro at Level 3 is lukewarm, well the feeling i have is you get what you paid for. Front-desk service was so-so , of course you do not expect service of a 5-start hotel as the price you paid for is what you will expect, especially when the apartment is located on a prime land. On the whole, I may recommend the hotel to my friends or return for my next stay and hope to see an improve in the quality of pillows provided! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Located in the heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: anggingyin
Reviews.Content: Citadines Ashley has always been my choice of stay due to the superb location. It is located on Ashley Road off Peking Road, just 5 minutes away from Tsim Sha Tsui station. The rooms are quite small but Hong Kong standard and has all the basic amenities. Nathan Road and all the shopping, eateries are just located a stone throw away, so it is good if you are looking for late shopping or eating and you want your hotel to be just nearby. Coming from the airport, you can either take the Airport Express to Hong Kong station then changed to get to Tsim Sha Tsui station. Get off at Exit C (Peking Road) and Citadines Ashley is just a 2 minutes walk. Alternatively, you can take the K bus from Kowloon Airport Express station and get off at Langdam hotel which is opposite Citadines Ashley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...That's it”
Reviews.Author: Kengkla
Reviews.Content: Stay for 1 night for business Just need a place to stay in Tsim Sha Tsui for 8 hours, so I booked this hotel because of location and price. Overall. the location is very good, walkable to everything nearby. Studio room is small, but it is still in HK standard. It is not so clean, and look old in some area. Bathroom has loud ventilation, and unconsistance hot water temperature. Free internet is +++. I booked via hotelclub with breakfast, but the hotel said that "No breakfast". I have no time to eat anyway, but I believe that the restaurant is very small as it is only 3 rooms in my floor. There are many restaurants on Ashley road and nearby. In conclusion, if you have limited budget, but in need of great location - just go for it. It is a lot cheaper than Langham, Kowloon hotel, or Marcopolo nearby. Tips: If you travel with baggage from HKIA via airport express, take complimentary K-2 shuttle from Kowloon station to Kowloon/Peninsula hotel. It is a bit longer walk than get off at Langham, but no need to claim the tunnel stair.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: fmdnzri
Reviews.Content: I had expected better since the hotel is part of The Ascott group, but I must say I'm disappointed. I have never stayed in any of Ascott's hotels or residence before, but I thought that this property was below my expectations of perhaps other hotels near the area with the same price range. We chose Citadines due to the amnenities, we wanted to cook our own meals in case it was hard to find Halal food in Hong Kong. The cookery was old, the hot water took some time to run, no view out of the window, staff was so-so. The good things I can say about the hotel are probably the location, and the free wi-fi in the room. Otherwise, I thought I would probably get a better deal else where.

Reviews.Title: “Citadine Ashley Hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Lori015
Reviews.Content: My daughter (13 ) and I stayed there April 17-20th 2012. Booked through Agoda-no problem. The mattress was firm, but didn't stop us from sleeping.The studio apartment is small, but that is Hong Kong. Location is excellent--within walking distance to many attractions and lots of restaurants on Ashley Rd. I couldn't find a place to buy food to do some of my own cooking, but restaurants are very inexpensive.The restaurant in the building serves a good breakfast for $30 HK dollars. The place was very clean, no bed bugs and I didn't hear noise from the room next door, though I'm not sure if it was occupied. The elevators were not slow as some have reported. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and will let you confirm your flight and print your boarding passes. A taxi from the airport cost $240 HK dollars and $200 going back ( special arrangement with the hotel ) . I figure it only cost me a few dollars Canadian more for the convenience of a taxi. if you have two or more people, a taxi really is worth it, especially if you arrive at night and have to try to find the place. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy apartment hotel with everything you might need”
Reviews.Author: caroltinio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our then 1 year old son and it is perfect for small families. And the rooms were spacious - compared to HK standards. We stayed in a studio premiere which was perfect because we had to have extra room for the baby cot which the hotel provided. The front desk was very helpful. There's a supermarket a few steps away, 7-11 and right across is a quaint chinese resto which serves the best roasted duck at a very reasonable price. Will definitely consider this the next time I'm in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we anticipated! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Clara81Singapore
Reviews.Content: Was much better than we antocipated! Locatiion Citadines Ashley is located along Ashley Road, TST. This is a street behind the main shopping street where all major international fashion brands are located! (Awesome!) Walkable distance to all TST shopping malls. restaurants etc. The nearest MTR station is TST/ East TST MTR station, exit L5. From L5, walk less than a minute and you will reach Citdines Ashley. (Super near!) Direction Exit MTR L5. Cross the road at the traffic junction towards Esprit. Then at Esprit, cross the road to the shop selling watches. With the shop selling watches on your right, walk upwards. Cross the small road and continue walking upwards. Few more shops and you see the lobby entrance of Citadines Ashley. (Do not want to miss the lobby? Take note then! Opposite Citadines Ashley is a big sushi restaurant) Room (We chose the smallest) For those who never been to HK, do note that most hotel rooms are small and expensive. Therefore, we are quite ok with the small rooms. Size: Small but adequate for our small family (2D1C share one queen size bed) Amentities: 1) Mini kitchenette (microwave, electric stove, pots/ pans, etc) with basin 2) Study table 3) Toilet with shower head, soft toilet bowl cover (no noise even I slammed the cover down) 4) Free wifi/ Lan (Just switch on the wireless modem) 5) Warbdrobe and another full length cupboard 6) Flat panel LCD TV (mounted swivel) 7) Laminted flooring (Bed area) and tiled flooring (Kitchenette area) 8) Individual aircon unit (adjust the temp yourself) 9) TV programms - GD! (Better than HBO.. Many great movies) Setting: Simple, modern and colourful Cleanliness: Fantastic! Daily housekeeping and very clean. No foul/ old furniture smell. Downside: No beverages (tea bags, coffees nor drinks in the fridge) Service Good customer service! Overall, the stay was fantastic. We slept well throughout those few nights and the staff were helpful.The location, service, room setting for such a price, what more can we ask? Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: kaitakkid
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor we were expecting a very small apartment, however on arrival we were really surprised that it was the size it was. For 2 people it was fine. It was what was called a studio. . Very clean and modern with a nice tiled floor. A large mirrored wardrobe with plenty of clothes hangers, plenty of shelf space and 2 good sized drawers. A safe in the apartment was great too. My only disappointment was that there were no easy chairs to sit on. There was 1 office type chair at the glass topped desk, where the internet connection was but it meant if 2 people were sharing the apartment only 1 got a seat, the other had to sit on the bed. There was a nice little space with a sink, one burner electric hob, fridge, microwave and kettle....quite adequate. Another thing I liked was that the window actually opened, and not just an inch or so but wide enough to get some air into the place. The shower room / toilet had a nice big shower space with a good pressure shower and plenty of hot water all day and evening, it never let us down. The toilet itself was spotlessly clean with a soft closing lid / seat. Towels and toileteries were replaced / replenished daily. The wash hand basin / vanity unit was separate. ( just outside the shower room door. There was a modern wall mounted TV with various international channels and an iron and ironing board also. For us the large roomy bed had quite a hard mattress, but the bed linen was lovely....very good quality and beautifully silky smooth cotton. All in all it was a good place to stay being so handy to all Tsim Sha Tsui has to offer. Plenty of eateries in Ashley Road The 2 lifts are both clean, smell nice, work well and are not slow as previous posts have indicated. No member of the public can use the lifts as they are card operated and only residents have a card ( given at check in )...good security. This was not our first visit to Hong Kong having been many times before, but it was the 1st time we've taken an apartment as opposed to a hotel room. We were resident for 3 weeks and we would certainly stay there again............especially if they provided better seating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TrueBrit_10
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Citadines, having previously stayed in a hotel in Kowloon on the waterfront, with more facilities than we required. Citadines is wonderfully located to explore the many aspects of Kowloon and the Island of Hong Kong. In addition, it is surrounded by convenience shops, restaurants and bars. Within a few minutes walk there is a supermarket, the MTR, buses and the Star Ferry terminal. The view from the rooms appears to be decreasing as new tall buildings go up. Unfortunately, the price of room has noticeably increased over the past few years and some areas are beginning to look a bit shabby. The Studio Executive apartments on the top most floors suffer from a support half way in the windows that restricts movement from that side of the bed, but it is not impossible to pass. However, we preferred the Studio Executive apartments because of walk in shower as opposed to a bath. We found the size of the room and ample storage was adequate for 2 people. The apartments are basically equipped for cooking with a small hob, and a microwave. Washing up of utensils and crockery is done with the daily service. There is also satellite television with stations in English though when we arrived BBC World had to be reinstated and we did lose CNN at some stage. The free broadband was very useful as well as the free local telephone calls. The furniture is very basic but adequate and there are in-room safes. There is a small reception area where you will find helpful and pleasant staff should you have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “FANTABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: martineism
Reviews.Content: Hands down, best hotel I've ever stayed. The room are very clean and has a partition between sleeping area and eating area. The room was spacious and even equipped with a dvd player. YOU'LL NEVER REGRET IT :)

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Bobby L
Reviews.Content: We were stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. I really think Ascott should take the Citadines name off of this hotel until they get it in shape. The bathroom is very small. The furniture was old. The room does not provide compliment water like other Citadines hotel in Bangkok. It was no more than a flop house. Disgraceful that such a high end company would lend their name to such a dump. The worse case is they did not makeup the room until 7:00pm after several attempt to ask the house keeper or front desk. They said will do but never did until you asked for several times. Also the internet did not work after several attempt to call front desk to fix it. They said that they will do but never until you keep asking. This is not a hotel--it is an old guest house that has not been refurbished. It was dirty and smelled like a sewer. The walls had not been painted in years. It was just terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Save budget at here.”
Reviews.Author: armam
Reviews.Content: The room is small but have everything you want, clean and good design to manage small area. Have pantry in room. Not far from MTR station near big shopping mall and many restaurant around that. It's good location a heart of TSim SHa Tsui. This hotel is cheap. Good to stay here. I visit HK many time but I impress this hotel most!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Clayton C
Reviews.Content: Hotel was cheap and did not do much research into it before i left so did not have great expectation. However, it was really great value for money....roons really small but its Hong Kong snd part of the experiance. Great location and could not fault hotel in anyway...no need to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “With Famly - Try it once”
Reviews.Author: hvsandip
Reviews.Content: I Visit Hongkong 3 times a Year , Mostly my bookings made by my Agent - But once He forgot to book it - And I stayed CITADINES.. Now onward i Always stay here - its fee awesome.. If anyone planning for Business come Family tour try once here You will live it.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: skylovechan
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel's location. Near Harbour City and Nathan Road. It's also near one of the Tsim Sha Tsui exits. No problems encountered with our booking. We got the room as soon as we checked in before 2pm. The room was just about right as described. Good enough for me and my husba since we are mostly out during the day. All the basics were provided (i.e. toiletries, small appliances, extra pillow, hair dryer, etc). The cleaning lady serviced our room everyday and changed our towels. However, the mattress is a bit hard. Not really comforting after a tiring day of walking around the city. They also do not have a heater so it can get a bit cold since we were there on a winter. The big plus though, is the free wifi! We have our own wifi router in the room and the internet connection is pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping, eating and public transportation”
Reviews.Author: gnyrret
Reviews.Content: Having travelled to Hong Kong many a time, this was a great find. I don't need breakfast in the hotel - only a comfy bed, quiet time at night and good pressure shower. I got all those at the Citadines. Although minimalist, the kitchen facilities allowed basically the heating of water or a pot to cook instant noodles. I liked the free internet, free storage facilty for baggage left while I went on a trip to China and the fact that the MTR was just around the corner. Also just around the corner was the McCafe (open 24 hours) and a bevy of restaurants. The airport bus A21 stops about two blocks away or you can take the airport hotel bus and stop at Langham Hotel (1 block away).

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, magnificent location”
Reviews.Author: gherbo
Reviews.Content: Citadines Ashley was true to its description, right smack in the middle of bustling Tsim Sha Tsui. Although Ashley Road is a sub-street that is not widely known, it is so near the MTR station and Harbour City that it doesn't really matter. The rooms were very minimalist, in the true Citadines style, but comfortably fit six people in two rooms. I'm staying at the Citadines in Shinjuku in the following months, and expect more or less the same. Will definitely opt to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: mrmnem
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel, where I stayed for three nights late november this year. Tsim Sha Tsui is a pretty good area, and Ashley Road in particular. Just around the hotel you can find a variety of bars and restaurants. Rooms are regular sized for HK (that is rather small compared to what you usually get in the US). Bathroom is a bit elementary, and because it's an apartment type hotel, there's no breakfast served (not ideal if you're not here on vacation). Your only option in the building are cafes starting service at 8am (too late in my case), or go in the area, you'll find anything you're looking for. Staff has been courteous to me at all times, and prices are reasonable. Overall, a pretty good place to discover HK & TST in particular!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Serviced Apartment in a "expensive" city”
Reviews.Author: Manson_T
Reviews.Content: Accommodation in Hong Kong is extremely expensive. If you are looking for staying in serviced apartment, I think Citadines is the cheapest choice. The room is a bit small, but it is tidy and clean. The small equipped kitchen is good for me to prepare light meals. The hotel locates at Tsim Sha Tsui which is a shopping area. All are convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Good Room”
Reviews.Author: KrisScotch
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I didn't expect much from this one as the review didn't seem that great but when we arrived, the receiptionist was very welcoming and informative. We got assigned to a big room while we would have to come back for another small room (we booked 1 big and 1 small) as we arrvied one hour before the check-in time. The big room was pretty good size, stay 3 in this room and the sofa bed (queen size) was fully set. Small kitchen is fully equipped as expected. We got the big room on 18th Floor, super brilliant to avoid the street noises day & night although we got another one on the 6th Floor and we couldn't hear a thing night & day and I'm a very light sleeper, I must say. When we got back in the evening and asked for the key to another room, the room wasn't still ready, they're still fixing the air conditioner and they couldn't give us any other room as it's fully occupied, and I was pissed. Somehow they have managed to compensate such plus the room was ready after 15-minute so I gave it a go for problem solving! The space is pretty good comparing to other hotel in Hong Kong and I like the modern decor with solid floor instead of typical old & dusty carpet you normally got from other hotel in HK. You can't get any better location, right in the heart of Tsim Sha Tsui and easy to reach Ferry Terminal and MTR station. Tip: Airport transfer is brilliant if you have small luggage and use Airport Express and MTR. Otherwise, you have to take a taxi coz airport shuttle bus (with a fee) doesn't serve this hotel but you may hop for the van limo (contact terminal 1) if you come for a group of 4 or more (HKD 580) and on the way back to the airport you can ask the hotel to book you the same limo services at even lower price (HKD 500)

Reviews.Title: “waste of money”
Reviews.Author: jcka
Reviews.Content: taxi does not come here as it is the busiest place, so walk with luggage for 10 min at least to reach the place. than the rooms are so small and bathroom is as good as one in the aircraft. try something else instead if you value your stay and money we left the place next day. again when u leave walk a while with luggage on busy roads to get taxi isnt that terrible.

Reviews.Title: “"good choice for short stay"”
Reviews.Author: BorisScuba
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends in Citadines for 2 nights during our Hong Kong trip. Although the rooms are quite small (it's a Hong Kong mate...), there is everything what you need even small kitchenette so you can prepare tea or coffee. There are many restaurants at Ashely road hence no need to cook. You can find Mexican, Singaporean, Hong Kong, Vietnamese, Italian, Irish restaurants and pubs just at the hotel's door step. It is a shame that Citadines are closing in December 2011. The location is just fantastic. MRT is about 70m away. Star Ferry terminal is 7 minutes walking distance. China Ferry Terminal (ferry to Macau) is only 7-10 mins by taxi (it is actually walking distance if you do not have a luggage with you). Nathan road with all the shops is just around the corner (5 min walking) There is also Irish pub at the first floor of Citadines and yes, they have a great Guinness Beer... I was nicely surprised by Citadines - it is great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: mikelima
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at the Citadines in Hong Kong. We booked this hotel because in October all the hotels in Hong Kong up their rates by 40 to 100%. This was available at a reasonable price of HK$1,500/- including tax. Normally HK$1,200/-. Having visited Hong Kong many times, We did not have undue expectations of the premises, especially for the price we were paying. This helps. Location: Excellent, close to the MTR (underground), restaurants, ferry. Reception: The reception area was small, but the receptionist were efficient. They spoke English. Check in was painless. Accommodation: The room was small, probably about half the size of a normal hotel room. The space was used efficiently with the bed in the corner, a desk with cable and a WiFi router. On the other side was a sink and a hot plate. The bathroom was small with a shower. We found the hot water worked. WiFi: Free and reasonably fast. Meals: None Comment: Do not have great expectations of this hotel. It is a place to sleep in at the end of the day. The air-conditioning works. It is cramped, but what do you expect for the price. I would stay there again, if I have to. But my personal preference would be to pay more for more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kentcruise
Reviews.Content: We have used Citadines in London & Paris and were not dissapointed with this hotel. Rooms are small, as is expected in densley populated cities but it was located in a place within easy walking distance of Star Ferries, Subway (one block), Kowloon waterfront, shopping (Nathan Rd) and Kowloon Park.Staff members were helpful and had many suggestions for using our time. By HK standards rates were very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “A shame it's closing.....”
Reviews.Author: Ginger019
Reviews.Content: We stay at Citadines on most occasions when we visit HK. We usually stay in the room which is not the basic room....one up I think (!) it has a small kitchen and a sofa bed and can easily accommodate 3 adults and a baby. The location of this Citadines is brilliant. Right next to the new isquare shopping centre, which used to be where the Grand Hyatt was on Kowloon side a few years ago. Isquare or is it red square......?...! has a supermarket...Marks and Spencer...Starbucks etc......and a plethora of other fine eateries. Citadines on Ashley is on the doorstep of several bars and restaurants and is a stones throw away fromHarbour city....Star Ferry terminal and a great view of HK island on a night. Joey, the lady at reception, is one of the most friendly ladies I know and will help and advice you on shopping trips and attractions. Like the title says......a shame it's closing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Strat77
Reviews.Content: Prices of hotels in Hong Kong are expensive. When my friend told me about this "shoplot" hotel which charges around USD200 a night, I honestly had my reservations. True enough, when I arrived, I was greeted by a narrow sliding door entrance and an even narrower walkway within the hotel after you minus the reception area. Reminded myself that I shouldn't be whining but instead make the best out of this stay. Here's the good part! To my surprise, the room was actually very nicely done. Not only was it clean, it was color coordinated to give you this very vibrant feel. It had everything I needed.. a big comfy bed, a mini kitchen with utensils, a set of sofas to chill in and a writing desk with complimentary internet. The toilets weren't fit for kings, but hey, clean and everything works was all I needed. I suppose the best part of this hotel would be its locality. Smacked right in the middle of Tsim Tsa Tsui (at least I think that's how you spell it). The rail transit, the harbour (star walk), a really nice park and rose garden, rows and rows of shops, great drinks and food are all within a stone's throw. Will I return here or recommend this place? A 100% yes.. unless you're planning to splurge a little on your next trip or to impress the lady, otherwise a big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location right in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui”
Reviews.Author: Chris0104
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Citadines for 2 night during my last Hong Kong trip and like it very much. Will definitely stay there again for my next Hong Kong trip. The location of this hotel is right in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui. Harbour city mall is located just 2 small road junctions away. It is also a 5-10 mins walk to the Tsim Sha Tsui station. Love the modern, clean cut decor of the room. It is very simple but some might find it small. Not a luxurious place to stay but I find it perfect for my needs. Added bonus is that there is a famous Macau biscuit shop near to the hotel, usually can only find the products in Macau but manage to find the shop here. No breakfast provided but hey you are in Hong Kong the food paradise!! No problem getting food. Just by stepping outside the hotel there are 2 cha chan ting in less than a 10 meters walk away ;) Staff are also friendly and helpful. On the day of leaving, knowing that I intend to take a taxi to the airport, they offer to help get one without my request. Appreciate the helpful gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: GuruandL
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be clean and compact (as it is Hong Kong, you have to expect that). It was really well located, very central to shops and the MTR, which was fantastic for getting about the city, even the connecting tunnels are good to walk through. There were 8 or more restaurants within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. While there was a kitchenette, it was pretty limited, but enough for breakfasts. The cost was ok for Hong Kong, which is quite expensive for accommodation. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Changed since my last review”
Reviews.Author: MikeyOz
Reviews.Content: The rooms remain comfortable and affordable - I am a big lover of rock hard beds and this is certainly the case here. Staff remain extremely friendy and willing to help out with just about any request. The location is still outstanding with very easy access to the Star Ferry, Nathan Rd and Tsim Sha Tsui MRT station. However - there is a nightclub directly opposite. I stayed for 2 weeks on this visit and after 3 days on floor 13 had to request a move to the 19th floor. The nightclub appears to operate 7 nights a week and until 4.00am. The noise is disturbing and the follow up noise of drunken patrons leaving (often yelling at each other) penetrated the double glazing with little difficulty. Ironically - the windows keep out most of the ambient traffic noise during the day - but for whatever reason - the nightclub noise is loud enough to disturb your sleep. Please note - once on the 19th floor - I could barely hear it and slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean room but difficult to locate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not actually my 1st time in hk but i had really difficult time locating the hotel from china ferry. Fyi, fr chinA ferry, go to canton road then cross to haiphong road turn right to hankow road then right again and walk shortly turn right and thats ashley road. Like this hotel because they have everything u need like utensils, microwave, u can also cook. Near nathan road, mtr and shopping area ;-) would definitely consider staying in citadines again the next time i visit hongkong!

Reviews.Title: “Super hard bed, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: typical_uranian
Reviews.Content: Unless you love hard bed, we suffered the 2 nights staying there. It's as hard as the floor. There's some pubs opposite the hotel and in the middle of the nights you'll hear the tempo of the music. Not worth the $$$ even though the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sainttom
Reviews.Content: These hotel apartments have only two things in there favour, their location and the free high speed internet. Everything else is not up to standard. The rooms are small and spartan, with the hardest bed I have ever known. The facillities listed some are not there, including the laundry room, which as advertised I had wanted to use and was told "we no longer have one as out of date". Its still listed on the web page and the main citadines site. The 3rd floor public toilet is one of the most filthy i have ever seen with no hot water or towels. You have to use this after your check out, if you want to leave luggage in the lobby. For the same price as these apartments you can get a 3 star hotel with pool and gym or for very little more. The staff are very helpfull and the room itself kept very clean. I complained about the lack of facillities and was given a small refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice to be able to make coffee and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: VBatlarge
Reviews.Content: This is a very handy place to stay in Kowloon - steps to the park, metro, Star Ferry and Nathan Road. The rooms are tiny but we chose it because it comes with a small kitchen so you can make breakfast and coffee which makes for a leisurely morning. The fittings are very modern and sleek, it's clean, and the wifi works well --- my only complaint is that there was just one chair in the room so it meant eating in bed for one of us, not too big a problem I guess. Overall, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Good Value,HARD BEDS”
Reviews.Author: rauchous
Reviews.Content: After travelling to Hong Kong on 3 occasions I was expecting a small room and was VERY pleasantly surprised when we walked into a very large comfortable room and then we got a phone call from reception to tell us we were in the wrong room and THEN we went to a VERY small room. But it was very clean and modern with everything we could have wanted,the only things we could find wrong were there in NO guest onsite laundry as stated on there website and the beds were ridiculously hard. The location is excelent only a short work to the Ferry terminal,Cruise Terminal and Nathan Road shopping area and a pleasent walk to the Temple St night market unless you get lost like we did, we saw a lot of Kowloon that night. I would highly recommend this hotel, but would suggest you pay a little extra and get the executive room NOT the standard as we did well worth the extra

Reviews.Title: “Don’t even think about it – it will just end in tears.”
Reviews.Author: Hut3Boy
Reviews.Content: Despite the delightful and helpful Joey on reception and the apparently good location, we cannot recommend this accommodation. There is nothing “Boutique” about the Citadines, more like park bench. We cannot understand how this establishment has achieved the rating it has. After a reservation stuff up (not ours) we had to split our 2 night stay between two different rooms. The 1st , a studio apartment which could best be described as shabby with tatty furniture, dysfunctional doors and lights, difficult toilet, broken thermostat on the AC and generally in need of serious TLC. A lack of kitchen ware (only 1 bowl) made the kitchenette facility close to useless. Our second room was close to microscopic with very little room around the bed, you pretty much had to climb on from the end. Though not quite as tatty as the 1st, still far from good or acceptable. Both beds were truly an example of man’s inhumanity to man, the mattresses, I use the term loosely, were the hardest I’ve ever experienced. I had to keep on checking they were real and not blocks of wood, they looked real but real sleep was simply impossible on these excuses for comfort. I’ve done a reasonable amount of travel/backpacking around Asia for over 25 years and never experienced beds like these. Shame Citadines, shame! There also appeared to be some serious night club action happening relatively close by which the Citadine is ill equipped to acoustically handle. Maybe this explains the beds, you’re not going to sleep anyway so why bother trying. Our 2 day HK homeward stop over was meant to be a little touch of luxury after nearly 6 weeks of backpacking in Europe but the Citadines totally spoiled this for us, the only real dud for the entire 6 weeks of travel so I suppose I can’t complain too much, but yes I will. Citadines is an expensive rip-off for a “seen better days” dive, don’t go near it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but a good location”
Reviews.Author: alicevarren
Reviews.Content: The Citadines is rather basic, but you get what you pay for it. The staff are nice and helpful, but if you check in late at night, they do not always have someone who speaks English. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and quiet. The restaurant, bar, and beauty salon are open Monday through Friday only. The location is great. It's close to the metro, shops, and other services.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: m4r14_10
Reviews.Content: We stay in August 13-17, 2010 and I like it .... 'cause by walking you can see many places, like space museum, my children likes it....malls, star ferry, clock tower etc. But, the room is too small... so, if you are going to be out all day long and only come to sleep, citadines is the right place...

Reviews.Title: “Good location.. but not worth”
Reviews.Author: py_bh
Reviews.Content: It is located very near MTR and shopping district, and easily accessible. Internet was available and the staffs were very helpful and friendly. However, as compared to the other Ascotts and Citadines apartments where I have stayed previously, this is rather disappointing. There are many services not available in the apartment itself, such as laundrette (it will be sent out instead). The room is small, and the room was not cleaned thoroughly. When I saw used undies found in the bathroom left by previous traveller/s, I was shocked and upset. My advice is to check the room thoroughly before settling in..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Most Recommended”
Reviews.Author: alongsj
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a 5 day 4 night holiday in HK. What a great time we had. I had read all the reviews about Citadine HK and decided to book 4 rooms for my family. Yep, there were 9 adults, 3 children and 1 baby in our group. I booked one studio for my parents, 2 studio premiers for my aunt and her 5 kids (3 in a room) and one studio executive for me and my family (2 adults, 2 children and 1 baby). The rooms were small but sufficient as a place to put our bags and land our heads for the night. They even prepared a baby cot for my baby. Most of our rooms were on the upper floors so noise from the street was not a problem. The beds were a bit hard but the fluffy pillows and quilts made up for the hardness. The sofa beds were great. My kids had such a great time sleeping on it; they wanted me to buy one when we got back home :D. The kitchenette was small but they had everything we needed; a toaster (good for making toast for breakfast), a microwave to reheat food we brought back, an electric kettle and also a stove, complete with pots and pans. The toilet also was nice and the shower was refreshing after a long day walking. The closet space was great as they had a place to put our shoes and hang our clothes. Oya, they also provided free internet. The staff were great too especially Joey who gave us great info and directions to all the attractions we wanted to go to. The rest of the staff were very friendly and always had a smile for us when we got back from a long day of sightseeing. Location wise, this hotel is great too. 10 minutes walk to the Star Ferry terminal and also to the nearest MTR (Tsim Sha Tsui). For Muslims, there is a great halal restaurant just behind the hotel (India Place). Great tandoori chicken and briyani rice. Also, along Nathan Road (5 minutes walk), lots of designer shops nearby. 7-11 and supermarket are also just around the corner. Avenue of Stars is also only a 15 minutes walk away. I would totally stay at this hotel again if I come to Hong Kong. Thank you Citadines for a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “clean, trendy and fully equipped”
Reviews.Author: sanChd
Reviews.Content: Citadines ashley is a really clean apartment hotel.The rooms have been tastefully built and the kitchenette is complete. Had a comfortable stay at this place with a small child. We could easily manage the food of our child here.

Reviews.Title: “It should have been better!”
Reviews.Author: aromas
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent guest to anything Ascott, be it Ascott in Bangkok, Somersets in all parts of Asia and Citadines in Europe. But this 8 day stay in Citadines in Hong Kong disappoints. Our first stay is for 2 days 23-25 March checking into a top floor Premier studio room 2101. Our first impression was good (clean and uncluttered and modern)but the bathroom needed repair (for a one year old serviced apartment) - the shower curtain smelt mouldy, the toilet seat was spoilt, and the shower stand was broken, but worst was the shower turning really hot and really cold on its own. The second check-in was 30 March to 5 April for 6 days of a dirty smelly room (room 2001) and erratic hot and cold showers again. This room was dusty, walls full of markings, bedhead and lamps dusty and cupboards and curtains even worse. After the first night, I asked for the studio to be thoroughly cleaned and the smelly shower curtain to be replaced- yes, they only cleaned the floor, replaced the shower curtain and left everything uncleaned and dusty. Subsequently we spent as little time as possible in the room. Increasing negatives were unstable broadband - you can't connect in the morning (so what if Citadines had free broadband if you can't use it). The ironing board shud be replaced with a sturdy one with a proper padded board (it was so thin that our ironed clothes had grill lines on it). Everyday when we returned to the room, it smelt of sewer and will disappear when the fans and aircon are turned back on. At any one time, there is only one staff at the reception counter - the ladies are friendlier altho obviously lonely. The male receptionist was entertained by his computer oblivious to anyone walking in or out. The lobby is non-existent - it is just a service counter - this Citadine is not true t its European heritage which is normally well-located, small, chic, clean and efficient and normally, they do have a proper lobby. Normally, you couldn't find a better deal than a Citadines. It is certainly an establishment that is badly managed (or not managed). The only positive in this Citadines is its location - close to MTR, shops, food and a close-by great laundry service. Look elsewhere for better accommodation and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Excellent Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: ter830
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at Citadines Ashley HK the past week, for my family trip to Hong Kong. Triple thumbs up for the stay there made possible by Citadines at Ashley. Firstly, the location of the apartment is just wonderful!! So convenient if you need any good food at anytime of the day. HK style dim sum restaurants, HK style tea and coffee houses, International food places, 24 hr convenience stores. They are all around the place of Citadines Ashley. Also shopping at Harbour CIty & i-Square is within 10 minutes walking distance. More importantly, the Tsim Sha Tsui MTR Station is also 10 minutes walk away. Secondly, though the rooms are pretty small, but all HK rooms are pretty small (I stayed in the standard studio rooms for 2), they felt comfortable and at ease. Great for just sleeping after a long day of shopping! Pretty well kept room as well everyday. Clean and Tidy! Kitchen utensils were pretty useful as well if one needs to pack food to your room! Last but not least, the most value added part of this place is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. My aunt injured her hand on one of our trips to nearby Macau and when we checked with the Citadines staff, she recommeded us to St Teresa Hospital for a more accurate and thorough examination of the injury, rather than to some untrustworthy street side Medical stall. Also, another of the staff assisted my aunt with some traditional treatment with Chinese ointment and helped to bandaged the injured part. It definitely helped to bring the swell in the injury down. It was a very much appreciated move by them. I never expected that at all, since it is not part of their job! Highly recommended place to stay at if you want to visit Hong Kong and stay in the midst of all the happening stuff!!!! I truely enjoyed this place!

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home”
Reviews.Author: xiaodingtang
Reviews.Content: My mum, sister and I had a great stay in Citadines which is nearby to MTR station (use the underground) and Shopping Mall. The hotel staffs are friendly and helpful, even though I got ton and ton of questions. Room space isn’t there big but it is good enough for three of us. The kitchen accessories are indeed useful, we even use the microwave to heat some food which we bought from the street. As for the bed, there are people who can’t get used to hard bed. For me, hard bed is my favourite. Internet come with free! You will be able find bakery shop which you can shop for local products to bring back home. And my daily favourite supper is from 1 stone throw away from the hotel, fast food restaurant which specialize in local food and western as well (only available for take away).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Kookaii
Reviews.Content: I love Citadines Hong Kong Ashley Aparthotel! I would definitely come back and stay here again. The location is excellent! You find youself right smack in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui area, just minutes from eateries, shops, the ferry terminal, MTR stations and the Kowloon park. We got the Studio room, it's got a decent-size double bed, a flat screen tv, a desk, a couch, a fridge, stove, toaster, heater, microwave and utensils. The bathroom is small but decent, stacked with the necessary toiletries and toothbrush. The towels were clean. It's the perfect studio room and has everything you expect. A few uncomfortable points for me would be the bed. It was a little on the firm side, which felt a little stiff for me, as i love fluffy and soft. However, my partner loved the bed as he prefers firm mattresses. Another would be the shower, it would turn cold from time to time, and return to hot and then cold. I think the trick is, when you feel it just about to turn cold, move the lever all the way to the left to make it hot again. When you have the right temperature, return the lever back to the middle. MTR and subway stations are a 5-min walk. The ferry terminal is about a 10-min walk. Harbour City mall is just around the corner. Noodle shops, eateries and restaurants practically surround the hotel. And there are 2-3 7-11 convenience stores downstairs, for your "convenience" :) Also, always remember to turn on the exhaust over the stove-top when toasting or cooking. The smoke detector is a tad bit sensitive :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Lengmui
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here. On the morning of arrival, we were greeted by this receptionist named "Joey". Totally exceeded my expectation, she was super friendly, and prompt to our request. When we arrived, our room was not ready, so she suggested a good place (and cheap too!) for delicious dim sum lunch just around the corner, and even suggested places for dinner and so forth. She planned out itenenary for us till the time our room would be ready. She speaks fluent english. She has definately given us a very good first impression of the service of this apartment. A plus point of the location is that Ashley road has a dead end on the other side, therefore there isnt much traffic passing by so noice is minimal. Also Ashley road is a great place for bars if Lan Kwai Fong is abit too noisy for you. We could just walk down the apartment and sit in the bar for drinks. There is a 24 hours eatery that sells noodle and rice. The seafood fried hor fun is a must try. Just few steps down the road, there are two 24 hours convenient shops too if you ever need anything at all. I would highly recommend it to travellers and would definately come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: peteratsydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in an exec studio for 7 nights in Nov 2009. The room was compact but very comfortable, with modern furnishings which make the stay better than an ordinary hotel room. As others have said, the location is great with easy access to MTR and ferry, plus heaps of eating options nearby. A plus is that Ashley Road is a no through road, so there is little traffic outside at any time. This was our third trip to HK and we are a bit choosy regarding accom and were very happy with Citadines. A couple of tips. The Airport Express train from HKG to Kowloon sells group of 2, 3 and 4 tickets at cheaper prices than individual tickets. You just need to know to ask for them. From Kowloon station catch the free Airport Express bus (K2 I think, check their website) to the Langham Hotel and it is only a slow 5 minute walk to Citadine. Reverse for your return journey. The bus comes every 12 mins or so. And get an Octopus card for travel around HK, it saves so much time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service & Location!”
Reviews.Author: tripbuggy
Reviews.Content: Will definitely stay with Citadines Ashley if I am going back to Hong Kong again! The front desk ladies are always very helpful. Be it asking about foot massage service, where to get famous Lao Po Bing (Wife Biscuits) and directions to places in Kowloon/Hong Kong. The rooms are clean and well had almost anything you will need (plus microwave, stove, cooking utensils and cutlery). Nothing I can complain about except the size which I understand is common in Hong Kong (we opted for the standard room which is the lowest category). Location is very good, very near Tsim Sha Tsui MTR, all the various sightseeing locations/activities (Star Ferry Terminal, Clock Tower, Ave of Stars, etc), food and shopping all within the area. You can shop all the way from TST to Mongkok via Nathan Road. Another thing to note is airport transfer service. This does not come free and has to be booked via your own means as hotels in Hong Kong usually do not provide this service. We went for Vigor airport transfer and dropoff at Langham Hotel (or Kowloon Hotel if you prefer). Be prepared to drag your baggage and walk over to Citadines after dropping off.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen1985
Reviews.Content: As we only had 4 days to plan our spur of the moment trip to Hong Kong I was in a bit of a panic as to where to stay... had no idea about the different areas of Hong Kong and we were on a tight budget... Well Citadines were the PERFECT place to stay! We arrived early in the morning (7.30am) and although our room wasnt ready we were able to use the bathroom and freshen up while they stored our luggage. We were upgraded from a Studio Apartment to an Executive Studio which was a great start to our holiday. The Executive Studio was very spacious (Room 1101) - Queen size bed which was seperated from the lounge/kitchen by a partion sliding door. It had a flat screen tv & DVD player which could slide between the bedroom & lounge and a full kitchen. Bathroom was also very spacious as it was wheelchair accessible. For our last 3 nights were were in a Studio Apartment (Room 901) which was still spacious but all in the one room. For our last night we were upgraded to an Executive Apartment (Room 1902) - this was my favourite as it was on a high level and had views across to Hong Kong Island. The hotel was in a great location - 2 minute walk to Nathan Road, 2 minute walk to TST MTR Station, 5 minute walk to the Star Ferry and around 10 minutes to the China Ferry Terminal (Macau). There is no restaurant on site, but there is a bar on level 1 - numerous eating places right outside including a great sushi place and a 7/11 around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jaffaBristol
Reviews.Content: These serviced apartments are in a good location and they serve their purpose very well. Our room was quite small but it had everything you needed for a few days in Hong Kong. You could make breakfast and a one pot meal with ease. There was a tv and dvd player if you wanted an evening in. The bathroom was lovely, the shower was very powerful and there was plenty of hot water. There is a small supermarket close by and restaurants if you fancy eating out. Its a short walk to the Star Ferry and the metro. The staff were also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Staying there again”
Reviews.Author: Postcode
Reviews.Content: Just back after a week at Citadines Ashley. I read the reviews here and was not disappointed at all. Hotel is near transport, shopping, restaurants, convenience stores, and anything else HK has to offer. The room was clean, recently refurbished and very pleasant. Free inroom broadband was fast and so necessary for travelers like myself. Three rooms per floor so quiet. Staff pleasant and helpful. The bed is hard though. I often visit HK and decided to try another hotel after the one I usually use had been dirty and with surley staff. So impressed with Citadines Ashley I'll be staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel for short stay in shopping paradise area”
Reviews.Author: phamondate
Reviews.Content: good location, convenience to go around, a bit expensive but nothing cheap for hotel in Hong kong anyway. Room is a bit quite small, but clean and well-equipped with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - great location!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyOz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights Jun 8 to 16, 2009. Rooms are decent size (by HKG standards) and comfortable. The beds are very hard - but I find that comfortable - so no problem for me. Located a couple of minutes from Tsim Sha Tsui MRT and Star Ferry terminal. Great restaurants within a stone's throw. Staff are very helpful - and arranged a taxi direct to the airport for HKD$200 (in 2007 I had to pay HKD$330). You can adjust the air conditioner to your desired temperature - which is not always the case with some of the hotels in town. Pay the extra to stay in a Premier Suite with a bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Small but functional”
Reviews.Author: JAM_Hols
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days. The room was pretty small and basic but had everything you could need. It was quite modern, minimalistic but functional. We had a fridge, even a hob and cupboards full of cutlery and dishes. Don't think it would be great if you plan to spend a long time in the room, but for us we spent all day out and about and literally just slept there. Who goes to Hong Kong and spends all day in their hotel anyway!?! There is no in house restaurant, so no breakfast but you don't have to walk far to find something. (There was two 7-11's within a minutes walk). The room also had a plug in cable for internet, no WiFi as far as we could tell/ The location was perfect. Right in the middle of Tsim Sha Tsui, surrounded by shops and restaurants. It is no more than a 2 minute walk to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station (on Nathan Road), which will take you anywhere you need to go in the city. It cost about 4HKD to get to Mong Kok for shopping and about 10HKD to get to central. It's close to Kowloon park which is a real contrast to the city hustle and bustle. It is about 10-15 minutes walk to Temple street which has a really good night market. In the other direction its only 5 minutes to the Star ferry crossing which gives the most awesome views across the harbour. If you're coming from the airport, the easiest way to get there is to get the airport express to Kowloon, then the MTR to Tsim Sha Tsui. Or it cost us about 45HKD for a taxi from Kowloon station.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumanthx
Reviews.Content: rooms are very small no gym no bar no restaurant very expensive room rates

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: seanfrom
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice - if I'm not on a budget to afford my all time favourite Hotel LKF on HK Island, this is my only other option. Citadines apartments are great value, and HK is no exception. Tell me one other hotel in HK that has free broadband, a lounge room area, a small kitchen, and DVD player for this price! Great location, great value. Check out Citadines in Shanghai and Xi'an as well. I'm at Citadines Xi'an whilst typing this - similar layout to HK, slightly bigger, and cheaper! Enquire on the hotel's website for promotions before booking through third party websites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel In The Heart of Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: JonandKatie
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Citadines from April 14 to April 18. The hotel is located on Ashley road, which is somewhere between Nathan road and Canton road. The hotel is an apartment style hotel. You basically get a bed, small kitchen area with dishes, microwave, small cooking stove, bathroom, small two person sofa/sleeper. The hotel and rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. I don't know about the other floors, but on our floor, there are two rooms. So my guess is that there are two rooms on every floor. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's only a few minutes walk from the TST train station, maybe 5 minutes max. It is also not far from the harbor, I would say it's a 10 minute walk from the hotel. There are many places to eat and shop near the hotel. The only negative comment I have about this hotel is the bed. The bed is the hardest bed I've ever slept on. It's like sleeping on a rock, seriously. It took about a night to get use to the hard bed, after the first night, I came to accept it. You get free WIRED high speed internet, so that's a major plus. The view from the room isn't the best, but we're not in Hong Kong to get a great view from our room :-) Overall, I would stay at this hotel again. Don't let the hard bed keep you away from this wonderful hotel, it's location and price are well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sharpette
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel in Nov 2008. Staff very very friendly and were happy to help us. Room was a good size with a sliding door that could separate the main bed from the pullout sofa bed. Location is excellent..close to shops, restaurants and MTR station. Only complaint is the bed was extremely hard.. my daughters pull out bed was alot softer...but this room was $1000(AUD) cheaper than the YMCA so we thought this was well worth it !

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartments well located, under renovation though (Oct 08)”
Reviews.Author: laguida
Reviews.Content: • Stayed here in October & the foyer was under renovation which was a pain. The entry to the lobby was very thin, only one person can walk down it at a time. Only one lift was working which meant sometimes there was quite a wait & it often smelled of paint. • Location was excellent. 5mins walk to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. The pedestrian walkways however and Ashley Rd were under construction so we were inconvenienced by this quite a bit and had to walk another block or two around the construction each time. • Checking in was painfully slow, took at least 15mins to be acknowledged by the guy on reception. Due to the tiny amount of space in the foyer whilst under construction, there was nowhere to sit or relax whilst waiting. • Rooms were nice, quiet, clean & had a fresh modern feel to them, bright furnishings and artwork. • We stayed in an Executive Studio which was comfy. A queen size bed with a sliding dividing door to seperate it from the couch/TV area & kitchen. • Good facilities in room: flat screen TV, DVD, Air con, kitchen utilities • Be careful wiht the light switches! One day we had no hot water and mentioned this to reception who assumed it was due to the construction. Later that day, still we had no hot water so called reception. The guy kindly came up to our room and after checking the taps for some time, he realised we'd acciddently flicked the hot water switch off (which is an unlablled switch on the same board as all the other light switches near the door). So beware of this switch. • View out of the window was pretty unpleasant - a construction site across the road. • All in all it was a nice stay and we were generally impressed, it was just a shame we came at a time when a lot of construction was taking place.

Reviews.Title: “whole building shaking due nearby demolition and construction”
Reviews.Author: jck331720
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Citadines before and liked it very much. Stayed there again from 25- 28 sept 2008 They do some minor construction in the lobby but thats not a big deal . I was booked at the 8th floor or so, and promptly woken up at 8 am by enormous noise -when i looked outside to the opposite side of the narrow street about 5 guys with drilling equipment were busy demolishing a 5 story house or whats left of it. It goes on nonstop till 6 pm. The girl at the front desk was nice enough and moved me up to the top floor (21st) but still the noise is terrible - if u plan to relax or work in the room u need the tv on at times :( Sunday they dont work so u can relax. I think the demolition will take about a month or so but than the pilling will start for a new building thats even worse! Further the airco was filthy and the choise of tv channels are limited to a few. No CNN or BBC just some Chinese and financial networks and local english tv Suggest to stay away for a year or so ......

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home. Almost”
Reviews.Author: eltan
Reviews.Content: It has everything I need, all in perfect condition. I was given a free upgrade which was possibly why I was quite impressed with the room. Check-in/check-out was fast and nice, the location can't be better unless you prefer to be on Hong Kong Island on the other side. A variety of restaurants/eateries were readily available on the same street. Only negative part was the renovation in progress. Made it a little stuffy in the public areas like lobby and corridors, and I had to share the elevator once with a workman and his ladder. The fire alarm was also triggered twice in the same day but they turned out to be false alarms (I figured that one out coz I was in the shower and didn't run out, and it turned out fine both times). Conclusion, unless you are really fussy, you'll like Ashley. I did.

Reviews.Title: “Ashley Apartments - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: goldcoastgirl87
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stayed at the Ashley Apartments in Hong Kong for a week in October last year. Ashley Apartments was great. The room was a good size, with a lounge that could be seperated from the bed by a sliding door. The shower was a tad annoying as it wet most of the bathroom floor, this was a minor issue though, you just learnt not to put anything on the floor. My main issue was how hard the bed was. I have a super soft bed at home though and a slightly bad neck and my partner thought it was fine, so if you do have a bad back think again about this hotel. The little bar on the 2nd floor was also great for a few drinks and snacks before dinner. It's ashame they didn't have a proper cafe or restaurant though for breakfast. Dinner wasn't an issue with so many restaurants in the area. When we went to Hong Kong all the other hotels at the time of booking were probably double the price so we did book here for the price. The great location though was a surprise. It was so close to everything, including transport, shops, Nathan Rd and restaurants. The small road it was located all was a dead end at one end so we didn't get any traffic noise and the street was lined with restaurants which was great. If I was to go to Hong Kong again I'd probably stay here again mainly because the location was so fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the aparments”
Reviews.Author: RiChina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ashley apartments, in Tsimshatsui, Hong Kong, over the Chinese New Year for 5 days. It was a really good experience. It took me a long time to deceide, as we are 2 adults, 1 4yr old child and 1 baby. Most hotels would not accept an extra bed, plus a babycot, in the standard and deluxe rooms. These apartments did. It was not very spacious, as the sofabed was left open all day, plus the babycot and the queen size bed, but it had enough space for the kids to play around in. Everything was very clean, new and modern. There was no breakfast included and no resturant in the building, but it has a small kitchenette and I made breakfast for the kids and then went for coffee at Starbucks nearby. The sofabed was very comfortable and could fit 2 children, the queenbed was also very comfortable. There was a sliding door between the "bedroom" and the living area that could be completly closed, we could not use it in the day, because then it became too small, but at night it gave that extra bit of privacy. It was very cold at night, and they gave us a little heater, so it was fine. The bathroom is small, but has eveything, the showerhead was really nice with very hot water all the time. They supply basic toilettries like showergel, shampoo, soap and toothbrush. They have a hairdryer too. The TV was big and good, but few channels to choose from, however they have a DVD player, and can be moved from the room to the living area. The kitchen is very basic with toaster, microwave, fridge, kettle and a two place stove. They have a small safe in the closet. When the sofabed is opened you have to remove the small table for eating, so that was not so good, but you can still sit at the desk and eat. We stayed out all day and just came back for a short rest in the late afternoon, before setting out for dinner. So even though the space is small, it was comfortable and well kept. They have closet space for hanging, plenty of shelves and two drawers, you have to pack everything away before moving around....you can't have an open suitcase on the floor with the sofabed opened !!!! The staff at the front desk are very friendly and go out of their way to help you and give you information on what you ask for. The apartments are very central, you walk to Nathon Road and to the harbour, to the ferry terminal and to the metro (MTR). We stayed in a studio executive room for 1170 HK$ (including taxes) per night during the chinese New Year holidays (rates go up alot during this time). We enjoyed our time there !!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: AA21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at the Ashley apartments for 7 days from 8th to 15th September 2007. We stayed in a studio room (room 203). Check in was quick and easy. Room was small and a bit crampy, good for maximum of 2 people. Room had a microwave, stove, toaster, kettle and all thing neccassary for cooking and eating. Room also included free internet, dvd player and flat screen TV. Also Ashley apartments is really safe as to acess lift you need to enter a pin. Location was awesome right on Ashley rd. With heaps of places to eat. Apartments where also right near Nathan rd and MTR. Rate for the room was also really cheap. Overall I would definately stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Citadines Hongkong Ashley
HotelInfo.Address: No.18 Ashley Road, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
